magpie.user

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.user.CommandHandler

  • public class CommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class turns text commands into actions.

    Future directions:

    • Allow accessing variables using ${name} notation
    • Implementing defineOptions(Object[] options) interface, that will allow passing models and such to subclass

      • runCommandOnVariable

        protected java.lang.Object runCommandOnVariable(java.lang.String variableName,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.Object> Command)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Pass commands to variables. The requested operations may generate some output, but otherwise generate null.
        Parameters:
        variableName - Name of variable to act on
        Command - Command to be executed
        Returns:
        Output from the requested operation, null if nothing generated
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If execution fails

      • handlePrinting

        protected void handlePrinting(java.util.List<java.lang.String> Command)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Run commands that require printing something to screen.

        Expects commands to be of the form: print <variable name> <command> [<options>]

        Parameters:
        Command - Print commands to be parsed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - For various reasons

      • runEvaluationCommand

        protected static java.lang.String runEvaluationCommand(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> Command)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Run an evaluation command. Given a model to run, a Dataset to generate attributes, and prints out the predictions.

        Usage: $<model> $<dataset> <entries...>
        model: Model used to make predictions
        dataset: Dataset template used to generate attributes
        entries...: Strings representing entries to evaluate

        Parameters:
        Command - Command to evaluate
        Returns:
        Table of results
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • instantiateClass

        public static java.lang.Object instantiateClass(java.lang.String ClassType,
                                java.util.List<java.lang.Object> Options)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Create new instance of a class given type and options. Class name must be fully specified within the magpie package (i.e. "data.materials.CompositionDataset")
        Parameters:
        ClassType - Full name of class to create minus "magpie"
        Options - Array specifying option commands (can be empty/null)
        Returns:
        Newly instantiated class
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - For various reasons

      • printImplmentingClasses

        public static java.lang.String printImplmentingClasses(java.lang.Class cls,
                                       boolean printPackage)
        Print the names and options (if applicable) of all classes that are subtypes of a certain class.
        Parameters:
        cls - Superclass of all objects of interest
        printPackage - Whether to print the package name as well
        Returns:
        List of names and options of all

      • printClassInformation

        public static java.lang.String printClassInformation(java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> allClasses,
                                     boolean printPackage)
        Given a list of classes, print the names of non-abstract classes and their options (if they implement Options)
        Parameters:
        allClasses - Set containing all classes to print
        printPackage - Whether to print the package name
        Returns:
        Names and options, formatted as a table

      • runTimerCommand

        protected java.lang.String runTimerCommand(java.util.List<java.lang.String> Command)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Run a certain time command. Two options:
        • start [<name>] - Initialize timer. If no name, alters default timer
        • elapsed [<name>] - Return elapsed time. If no name, prints default timer
        Parameters:
        Command - Timer command to be parsed
        Returns:
        String describing result
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • printCitations

        public void printCitations(java.util.List<java.lang.String> command)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Run command to print out citations. First word should be "citations". If there are additional words in the command, they should be names of variables

        Usage: citations [<variable names...>]
        variable names: Optional: Names of variables to be printed

        Parameters:
        command - Command to be run
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If variables are not found in workspace

        Parameters:
        variableName - Variable to be assessed
        Returns:
        Lines of output for
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
